perturbation.original_text: The object of the Affiliate Program provided by element 5 (hereafter, "Program") is to publish electronic advertisements on the Web site of the Affiliate for selected software products offered by element 5 Software Publishers. Instead of fixed compensation, the Affiliate receives result- dependent Advertising Cost Compensation (also known in the element 5 Control Panel as "Commission") in exchange for publishing the advertisements. The Advertising Cost Compensation depends on the actual sales generated by end users referred via the electronic advertisement (the Affiliate's link).
perturbation.changed_text: The object of the Affiliate Program provided by element 5 (hereafter, "Program") is to publish electronic advertisements on the Web site of the Affiliate for selected software products offered by element 5 Software Publishers. Instead of fixed compensation, the Affiliate receives result- dependent Advertising Cost Compensation (also known as "Reimbursement") in exchange for publishing the advertisements. The Advertising Cost Compensation depends on the actual sales generated by end users referred via the electronic advertisement (the Affiliate's link).
perturbation.explanation: The term "Commission" is replaced with "Reimbursement". While seemingly similar, "Commission" implies a percentage-based payment for sales generated, whereas "Reimbursement" suggests a repayment of expenses, creating ambiguity and potential disputes about the basis of payment.
perturbation.location: I. Object of the Affiliate Program/ Affiliate Management Program for Software Publishers

perturbation.original_text: The Affiliate shall indicate on its Web site that (i) the Affiliate is acting as an independent partner of the respective Software Publisher by participation in the Affiliate Program provided by element 5 and (ii) The Software Publisher is the seller of the product and the payment process is administered by element 5. (3) The Affiliate shall produce a brief description for each activated product on its Web site. The Affiliate is responsible for the content, the style and the layout of this information. The Software Publisher can provide the Affiliate with graphics and text in an electronic format for use in describing the product, which the Affiliate shall use for the purpose of advertising the Products under the Agreement and links according to the instructions of the Software Publisher.
perturbation.changed_text: The Affiliate shall indicate on its Web site that (i) the Affiliate is acting as an independent vendor of the respective Software Publisher by participation in the Affiliate Program provided by element 5 and (ii) The Software Publisher is the seller of the product and the payment process is administered by element 5. (3) The Affiliate shall produce a brief description for each activated product on its Web site. The Affiliate is responsible for the content, the style and the layout of this information. The Software Publisher can provide the Affiliate with graphics and text in an electronic format for use in describing the product, which the Affiliate shall use for the purpose of promoting the Products under the Agreement and links according to the instructions of the Software Publisher.
perturbation.explanation: The term "partner" is replaced with "vendor", while "advertising" is replaced with "promoting." While the original text suggests a collaborative relationship, the revised language implies a more formal, contractual arrangement. This can cause confusion regarding the degree of control the Software Publisher has over the Affiliate's activities and the legal liabilities.

perturbation.original_text: Either party may cancel this Agreement at any time, with or without supplying a reason, through written notification or by making suitable settings in the respective Control Panel.
perturbation.changed_text: Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time, with or without supplying a reason, through written notification or by making suitable settings in the respective Web Interface.
perturbation.explanation: Here the term "cancel" is replaced by the word "terminate", and "Control Panel" is replaced by the term "Web Interface". This could cause confusion regarding the process for ending the agreement. While "cancel" implies a simple nullification, "terminate" suggests a more formal cessation with potential consequences. The change from "Control Panel" to "Web Interface" introduces ambiguity about the exact method for initiating termination. This perturbation undermines the clarity of the termination clause.
